body_html: Just a quick suggestion: have you tried adding writer.flush() or writer.close() after writer.add_summary(...)? The tf.train.SummaryWriter class writes events to a file asynchronously, so if you exist immediately after writing the event, it may not appear in the log.
body_text: Just a quick suggestion: have you tried adding writer.flush() or writer.close() after writer.add_summary(...)? The tf.train.SummaryWriter class writes events to a file asynchronously, so if you exist immediately after writing the event, it may not appear in the log.
body: Just a quick suggestion: have you tried adding `writer.flush()` or `writer.close()` after `writer.add_summary(...)`? The `tf.train.SummaryWriter` class writes events to a file asynchronously, so if you exist immediately after writing the event, it may not appear in the log.
